When private anger turns into a social force
subhead: In France, anger is everywhere: in the public sphere, in the media and at the ballot box. The majority of French people under the age of 35 say they have experienced it. From private feelings to collective outcries, they search for ways to channel this emotion.

Two births and 27 deaths in one Polish village: The collapse of the country's birthrate
subhead: With an average of 1.03 children per woman, Poland has the lowest fertility rate in Europe. Increasing family allowances has not changed that. The exhaustion of the population following the collapse of the 1990s, and then two decades of economic boom, is one of the explanations.

headline: The first time Le Monde wrote about Jeffrey Epstein
subhead: On Thursday, November 20, the US president signed into law the release of the judicial file on the sexual predator. The banker's name first appeared in the pages of the evening daily on March 11, 2011.

headline: Long-lost Rubens 'masterpiece' sells for almost €3 million
subhead: The work of Jesus Christ on the cross, painted in 1613, was unearthed by auctioneer Jean-Pierre Osenat in a Paris mansion last year.

headline: The French Senate's €1.8-billion rainy day fund
subhead: While the French government searches for funds, the Sénat holds €1.8 billion in financial assets. However, its reserves are slowly dwindling.

The last-minute fight to save Gaza's ancient archaeological treasures
subhead: Amid the vast destruction of the war, a small group of determined individuals fought to save Gaza's archaeological heritage. On September 10, they secured a few hours' reprieve from the Israeli army before a storage depot filled with artifacts was bombed to perform a delicate evacuation – the result of intense, high-level negotiations.

headline: Andriy Yermak's resignation shocks Europe, but suits the US
subhead: With Volodymyr Zelensky's top aide stepping down, the EU loses a key interlocutor in Kyiv at a pivotal moment in peace talks. The Trump administration, by contrast, seems ready to leverage the crisis to push its own priorities.
byline: Philippe Jacqué,  Philippe Ricard and  Piotr Smolar

headline: Paris restaurants with a New York attitude
subhead: The French capital has recently seen a wave of New York-style restaurants spring up, from slice shops to delis and red sauce joints. Parisians are flocking to these spots to savor not only a slice of culinary culture but also the enduring myth of the Big Apple.
